medium: Pen and brown ink and wash
title: Saint Catherine Enthroned with Saint Lucy and Saint Agatha
text: This drawing was recently conserved; the treatment was funded by a generous grant from the McCrindle Foundation. Small wholes were repaired where the heavily applied ink had eaten through the paper, seen, for example, in the handle of the sword St. Catherine holds, as well as the corner of her book. The study was executed in iron gall ink, a corrosive medium favored by Italian draftsmen in the 17th century, which is made from mixing iron sulphate with crushed galls, the growths that form on oak trees around insect larvae.
description: seated female figure holding feather-like object and book in PR hand; sword (?) in PL hand; two female figures standing on either side; architectural background; broken wheel, center front
creditline: Gift of the Joseph F. McCrindle Collection
